metadata.title: CVE-2024-46757 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:hwmon: (nct6775-core) Fix underflows seen when writing limit attributesDIV_ROUND_CLOSEST() after kstrtol() results in an underflow if a largenegative number such as -9223372036854775808 is provided by the user.Fix it by reordering clamp_val() and DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST() operations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-46757` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-generic - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-lowlatency - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1139-gcp - 5.4.0-1139.148~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1082-ibm - 5.4.0-1082.87~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
